page.title: 14Guide Dogs(Types) Leamington
page.content: This was Britains first permanent guide dog centre. The Guide Dog Association is responsible for 5660 dogs. 3500 are working dogs. 230 are breeding stock. 800 are walking. 500 are retired. 630 are training. Guide dog training was introduced to Britain from America in 1931.The two lady founders were Mrs. Muriel Cooke and Mrs. Rosamund Bond. The guide dog movement started in Germany 1916. The Germans trained Alsations trained to help men which were blinded in the war. The Guide dog association has, 57% female dogs 43% male dogs 43% Labrador 29% Labrador * Golden Retiever 10% German Shepherd 11% Golden Retriever 3% others. (continued next page).
